title: If you are smufing don't expect others to be on the level of your main
body:
So... I played a few games on my lvl 10 smurf and I must say the toxity is higher then in SoloQ. Its already enough to write Hey I'm new can you give me a few tips? and u'll get a stfu stupid noob go and play tutorial. Now actually I played well so there was no ingame flame but imaging that as a new player ure thrown into a game of toxic smurfs is horrible. So if u ever meet a newbie pls help him and dont flame him, sadly this only happend to me once where that player took me to top with him and explained me quite alot ( explained buffs, csing, hell even powerspikes ) at this point ty man we need mor players like you.

in essence Pls be nice to newbies we all started this game once

While I certainly agree with you that toxicity in this community is a problem, I'd counter that smurfing is also just as much of a problem.  When I was level 10, I was still working out how jungling worked, and I'm sure that there are lots of players below level 20 who'd agree with me when I say that smurfs make the game a lot less fun than it should be, IMO.

The issue is that Riot has a little box where you give your experience playing League. If you admit you're a smurf then it matches you against level 30s and other smurfs. But people who are mean or were banned say they're new to League and end up ruining the experience for starting players :/

This is certainly not true. I marked myself as second from the right (not sure what it was.. veteran or something) and I'm not getting matched against level 30s. I'm relatively new to league (played a couple years ago for a couple months but quit for some reason, don't remember why and can't remember the account so I started a new one) but I've played other MOBAs so that's why I chose that option.

I get matched against a lot of bots, feeders, and people in general who should still be practicing in AI games.

It gets very tiresome when some of the bots do better than some of the human players. If I was getting matched against level 30s, I imagine I would see far fewer bots/noobies who ruin the game.

I think that reports against players under level 15 should be weighed much higher than reports at level 30. For example, if at level 30 it takes 10 reports to get banned, at level 1-15 it should only take 2. This would help erase toxicity in the lower levels because there would be a much higher ban rate. I understand that these people don't care about their smurf accounts, but maybe if they get banned 2-3 times then they will get the point.

That could really backfire.  

Imagine if a true newbie fed 0/7 unintentionally and gets harassed by duo queue smurfs. The newbie, not accustomed to flame, might retaliate back in frustration and BOOM baited. Double reported and banned.  

How would that feel?  

No newbies would ever play this game.
Ok, valid point. Of course this would have to be in the tribunal under a special category possibly, so people could look for baits like that.

The chat might as well not even exist if it's going to be this harsh. I've only come across 1 or 2 truly toxic people. The real toxicity is in the people doing troll reports because they know the system will falsely punish.

@OP The issue is that a large majority of players in low ELO are EXTREMELY toxic and do not listen. For example I was smurfing today on a Silver account, and I was very polite to my team the entire time but was met with extreme hostility and verbal abuse. This continued the whole game until I snapped on all of them and not only ended up losing the game because of them fed but got reported i'm sure. I reported them too but nothing happened

First rule of smurfing - DON'T tell people you are smurfing.

The obvious reason is because you just sound like a condecending ass hole.  The team will not listen to you because you've just turned them off, not because they're toxic but because you're an ass.

The less obvious reason is that many people say they're smurfing to get the role / pick they want and are lying about it, proceeding to feed and flame afterwords.

On what world do you live on where ""hey guys i'm smurfing, be open minded to my advice please i'm here to help"  makes me sound like a condescending asshole you clearly have inferiority complex if that's the case, do you get mad at your job because someone shows you how to do something? So don't try and justify this behavior, that's another issue in itself. Secondly I love how you called me an ass because of them being incredibly toxic. Jesus christ, now I do want to patronize you because if you think everyone who's better than you at something is an "ass" you're going to live a very sad depressing life

I'm telling you why, and it's great because you illustrate your own condition so well.

I say "don't tell people you're smurfing and here is why" 

Your response - you attack me.  You tell me I have an inferiority complex, assume I'm a bad employee, and then cuss and say you want to patronize me, telling me I will have a very sad and depressing life.

A question: is the last person on your team's silence bothering you? I'm not accusing you, I'm just sincerely curious. Because when my team fights, I usually just not join so I don't get reported by some rager. So, since you are usually the one in the conversation, I will ask you: does it bother you? 

Finally (I'll stop bothering you), do you consider yourself a troll? I know that a lot of people make smurfs to troll. Is that what you're doing? Or are you sincerely trying to raise some poor soul in elo hell?

Hey there, I agree there are a lot of trolls in this game. That is part of the huge problem with League right now. Secondly that's exactly the massive problem with Silver Q right now. If you were thinking logically you would understand not even challenger players dodge every single skill shot, unless you're scripting it's almost nearly impossible to dodge every single skill shot in the game, that would be insane so I don't know why you have such suspicions that are rooted in illogical reasoning. I see you used the word "any" to my words if you read the script properly "i hit him with a Q one time" which is two very very different things


Secondly that's kind of the point of this point, why do Silver players think smurfs are automatically assholes when they are showing no signs of being what you are accusing them of. That is the issue with low elo players. If I had Dyrus/any high elo player comes in my game and go "Ok guys i'm giving you all a free lesson on League of Legends" I wouldn't immediately assume he was an asshole who was condescending me. That is inferiority complex. Thirdly I wouldn't become toxic to him for giving me advice even if I thought it was wrong, I might not do it but it wouldn't send me in a complete flux. 


Sure no worries, it would be hard to offend me through League boards....I post on many places because I find Riot's complacency with issues that have been present for many years, sort of appalling. They vigorously defend that 99.99% of players are not toxic and do not get banned, however I can promise you despite Negativity Bias, this number is most definitely higher than what they are claiming. This is not my normal acc that I play on I use this account solely for boards use, so I don't get people trolling me in ranked when they notice my name etc.


Lastly, the last person on my team's silence does not bother me in one bit. He's choosing not to take part in the disgusting acts of his teammates, I can only assume he's fed up and does not condone their actions and wants to get through the game as calmly as possible without any confrontation.

Lastly I'm not a troll, farthest thing from actually. I'm a competitive person, and I love to win. I hate to lose, I play in this elo, because my even though my main is very high ranked and has all champions and runes I could possibly want. I wouldn't be there long if I was constantly trying out new champs in ranked, and with my competitive spirit I don't find much enjoyment in norms, and it's mostly a crap shoot of random builds. So I take to ranked in a low elo to learn mechanics and play of new champions until I can climb -said account- to a high enough level I would test out a ranked game on my main account. I still usually maintain an extremely high  win rate on these smurfs but I genuinely would love to help polite, mature silver players get to their respective level through advice

A few months ago, before I was even level 30 I was doing some unranked pvp. I was trying adc and explained to my support that I was newish to the game and had only done jungling in pvp. I understood the basic concepts from watching tons of streams as well as cooping vs bots, but didn't know pvp. His reply was "sorry I don't play support for new players" and he just left the lane and instead stole cs from the midlaner, leaving me to 1v2 the bottom lane (in essence hurting the _entire team_, not just me). He occasionally came to bottom lane to compete for my cs when the midlaner had out cs-ed him in that lane. This was in combination to various harassment and flaming from him to the entire team. The only good part was this unified the other 9 people against him, the enemy team knew clearly that he was ruining the game.

That is one good thing about this community: if someone is ruining the game for everyone, the other team might unify against him as well.  I remember  a while back in ARAM, there was a Viktor on the other team who kept walking right into the middle of my team, and just let us kill him.  He wasn't casting any spells or attacking, he just walked up towards us and didn't stop until he died.  If I remember right, the report I sent in to the tribunal said something along the lines of "While we greatly appreciated how he let us keep killing him, I doubt his team thought so."

Same happens in my country, and I think it happens in every server. I've played some Coop vs AI, only to raise this account level and I saw toxic behavior in some matches. Most of the time it was rage and trash talk against new players trying to lane "where they not supposed to" (a.k.a. I SAID MID FIRST, LEAVE HERE NOW YOU F%%%IN' RETARD! I'LL REPORT U!)

Some people have been playing LoL long enough that they forget that there are people who don't know the first thing about this game, or MOBAs in general.

When I first started, I played Annie and summoned Tibbers on a big minion wave because I thought Tibbers worked like a pet from MMOs. He showed up, helped me clear a wave, then left until I needed him 80 seconds later. This is the kind of stuff you _must_ expect from people below level 30; a lot of them simply don't know any better. They're not in the right mindset to play League yet.

Hell, I used to rush {{item:3026}} as my first item because I saw how often I was dying and thought that a GA would cut down on the number of times I died. It did, but I didn't even think about things like powerspikes and the negative effects of rushing resistances on DPS champions.

So if you're smurfing under level 30, you shouldn't be calling out your allies because they do things you would never do. Instead, you should be thankful that they all don't wander the jungle for ten minutes, wondering where they get the quest to kill ten wolves for the shopkeeper.

Powerspikes occur when a champion's power increases dramatically after obtaining a certain item or level. A few examples are corki buying triforce or ap kog reaching level 11.

Playing around these spikes and using them to your advantage can help you snowball games.
